ticket.title: Ability to pass params to the routers
ticket.original-body:
Couple days ago, I was trying to make my rails application has a one-level-url like in Facebook and Quora.
I dag little bit and i guessed i found a solution. But unfortunately Rails 3.0.3 doesn't pass `params` to the routers.
@@@ ruby match '/:slug', :controller => proc { Slug.find_by_slug(params[:slug]).controller }.call, :action => :show @@@
But I could pass params to the `redirect` method in the router.
@@@ ruby match "/stories/:name" => redirect("/posts/%{name}") @@@
So, it could be a feature to make the routers able to access `params`!
